Definition 1.2.1 (Main problem). Let Unknown identifier `Q1`Q1 be a bounded closed convex set in a finite-dimensional real vector space Unknown identifier `E1`E1, and let be continuous and convex on Unknown identifier `Q1`Q1. The main optimization problem is (equation (2.1)).

noncomputable def MainOptimizationProblemValue {E1 : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E1] [NormedSpace E1] [FiniteDimensional E1] (Q1 : Set E1) (f : E1 ) : := sInf (f '' Q1)

Definition 1.2.2 (Explicit max-structure model). We say that Unknown identifier `f`f admits an explicit max-structure if there exist a finite-dimensional real vector space Unknown identifier `E2`E2, a closed convex bounded set Unknown identifier `Q2`Q2 in Unknown identifier `E2`E2, a linear operator , and continuous convex functions and , such that for all Unknown identifier `x`sorry sorry : Propx Unknown identifier `Q1`Q1, (equation (2.2)). The text also notes an implicit simplicity assumption on Unknown identifier `phihat`phihat and Unknown identifier `Q2`Q2, and illustrates non-uniqueness via the conjugate representation (equation (conjugate_representation)).

def AdmitsExplicitMaxStructure {E1 : Type u} [NormedAddCommGroup E1] [NormedSpace E1] [FiniteDimensional E1] (Q1 : Set E1) (f : E1 ) : Prop := (E2 : Type v) (_ : NormedAddCommGroup E2) (_ : NormedSpace E2) (_ : FiniteDimensional E2), (Q2 : Set E2), IsClosed Q2 Convex Q2 Bornology.IsBounded Q2 (A : E1 L[] (E2 L[] )), (fhat : E1 ), ContinuousOn fhat Q1 ConvexOn Q1 fhat (phihat : E2 ), ContinuousOn phihat Q2 ConvexOn Q2 phihat x Q1, f x = fhat x + sSup ((fun u => A x u - phihat u) '' Q2)

Definition 1.2.3 (Adjoint form). Assume equation (2.2). Define by (equation (2.3)).

noncomputable def AdjointFormPotential {E1 E2 : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E1] [NormedSpace E1] [FiniteDimensional E1] [NormedAddCommGroup E2] [NormedSpace E2] [FiniteDimensional E2] (Q1 : Set E1) (Q2 : Set E2) (A : E1 L[] (E2 L[] )) (fhat : E1 ) (phihat : E2 ) : Q2 := fun u => -phihat u + sInf ((fun x => A x u + fhat x) '' Q1)

Definition 1.2.3 (Adjoint form, adjoint optimization problem). Assume equation (2.2). The associated adjoint optimization problem is (equation (adjoint_problem)).

noncomputable def AdjointOptimizationProblemValue {E1 E2 : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E1] [NormedSpace E1] [FiniteDimensional E1] [NormedAddCommGroup E2] [NormedSpace E2] [FiniteDimensional E2] (Q1 : Set E1) (Q2 : Set E2) (A : E1 L[] (E2 L[] )) (fhat : E1 ) (phihat : E2 ) : := sSup (Set.range (AdjointFormPotential Q1 Q2 A fhat phihat))
